content: दंडः --डं [दंड् --अच्] {@--1@} A stick, staff, rod, mace, club, cudgel; पततु शिरस्यकांडयमदंड इवैष भुजः <ls>Māl. 5. 31</ls>; काष्ठदंडः. {@--2@} The sceptre of a king, the rod as a symbol of authority and punishment; आत्तदंडः <ls>Ś. 5. 8.</ls> {@--3@} The staff given to a twice-born man at the time of investiture with the sacred thread; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 2. 45-47</ls>. {@--4@} The staff of a संन्यासिन् or ascetic. {@--5@} The trunk of an elephant. {@--6@} The stem or stalk as of a lotus, tree &c.; <ls>U. 1. 31</ls>; <ls>Māl. 9. 14</ls>; the handle as of an umbrella; ब्रह्मांडच्छत्रदंडः &c. <ls>Dk. 1</ls> (opening verse); राज्यं स्वहस्तधृतदंडमिवातपत्रं <ls>Ś. 5. 6</ls>; <ls>Ku. 7. 89</ls>; so कमलदंड &c. {@--7@} The oar of a boat. {@--8@} An arm or leg (at the end of <ab>comp.</ab>). {@--9@} The staff or pole of a banner, a tent &c. {@--10@} The beam of a plough. {@--11@} The crossbar of a lute or a stringed instrument. {@--12@} The stick with which an instrument is played. {@--13@} A churning-stick. {@--14@} Fine; <ls>Ms. 8. 341</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">9. 229</ls>; <ls>Y. 2. 237.</ls> {@--15@} Chastisement, corporal punishment, punishment in general; यथापराधदंडानां <ls>R. 1. 6</ls>; एवं राजापथ्यकारिषु तीक्ष्णदंडो राजा <ls>Mu. 1</ls>; दंडं दंड्येषु पातयेत् <ls>Ms. 8. 126</ls>; कृतदंडः स्वयं राज्ञा लेभे शूद्रः सतां गतीं <ls>R. 15. 53.</ls> {@--16@} Imprisonment. {@--17@} Attack, assault, violence, punishment, the last of the four expedients; see उपाय; <ls>Ms. 7. 109</ls>; Cf. <ls>Śi. 2. 54.</ls> {@--18@} An army; तस्य दंडवतो दंडः स्वदेहान्न व्यशिष्यत <ls>R. 17. 62</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 65</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">9. 294</ls>; <ls>Ki. 2. 12.</ls> {@--19@} A form of military array. {@--20@} Subjection, control, restraint; वाग्दंडोऽथ मनोदंडः कायदंडस्तथैव च . यस्यैते मिहिता बुद्धौ त्रिदंडीति स उच्यते .. <ls>Ms. 12. 10.</ls> {@--21@} A measure of length equal to 4 Hastas. {@--22@} The penis. {@--23@} Pride. {@--24@} The body. {@--25@} An epithet of Yama. {@--26@} <ab>N.</ab> of Viṣṇu. {@--27@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. {@--28@} An attendant on the sun. {@--29@} A horse; (said to be {%<ab>m.</ab>%} only in this and the preceding four senses). {@--30@} A particular appearance in the sky (similar to a stick). {@--31@} An uninterrupted row or series, a line. {@--32@} Standing upright or erect. {@--33@} A corner, an angle.

दंडः --डं [दंड् --अच्] {@--1@} A stick, staff, rod, mace, club, cudgel; पततु शिरस्यकांडयमदंड इवैष भुजः <ls>Māl. 5. 31</ls>; काष्ठदंडः. {@--2@} The sceptre of a king, the rod as a symbol of authority and punishment;
